Hotel Marketer Job at Maison Fahrenheit




        
    

        
        Maison Fahrenheit, situated in the heart of Lagos, Victoria Island, is a boutique hotel that combines elegant design, personalized service, and a fusion of modern and African aesthetics. Our dedicated team is committed to crafting unforgettable experiences for our guests, making every stay exceptional. Join us in our mission to redefine hospitality in Lagos, contributing to the success of our unique boutique hotel in this dynamic and culturally rich environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Hotel Marketer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Develop and execute marketing strategies to increase hotel bookings and brand visibility.
	Manage and grow our social media presence with engaging, high-quality content.
	Identify and close partnership or corporate deals that drive revenue.
	Create and manage promotional campaigns for special events, packages, and offers.
	Build strong relationships with potential clients, influencers, and hospitality networks.
	Monitor marketing analytics to track performance and improve results.
	Bonus: Edit videos to create attractive visual content for marketing purposes.


Requirements


	Proven experience in marketing, preferably in hospitality or tourism.
	Strong social media skills (Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, LinkedIn).
	Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
	Ability to think creatively and execute innovative campaigns.
	Self-motivated, target-driven, and able to work independently.
	Video editing skills are a plus.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: om@maisonfahrenheit.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Packaging Manager",
  "description": "International Breweries Plc - Our Dream is to bring people together for a better world. Beer, the original social network, has been bringing people together for thousands of years. We are committed to building great brands that stand the test of time and to brewing the best beers using the finest natural ingredients.

Our diverse portfolio of well over 400 beer brands includes global brands Budweiser, Corona and Stella Artois; multi-country brands Beck&rsquo;s, Castle, Castle Lite, Hoegaarden, and Leffe; and local champions such as Aguila, Bud Light, Jupiler, Klinskoye, Modelo Especial, Quilmes, Skol, and Victoria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Packaging Manager

Job Requisition ID:&nbsp;30082266
Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Job Type:&nbsp;Full-time

Summary


	The Key Purpose of this role is to manage and co-ordinate the Packaging Department in order to achieve the required standard of product quality and output in the most efficient and effective manner.


Key Roles and Responsibilities
Manage plant, process and systems:


	Translates and implements packaging, manufacturing and business strategies across the packaging hall.
	Ensure that all team members are fully conversant with the VPO.
	Develop and drive implementation plans to progress our VPO Principles / agreed VPO Pillar Blocks in order to sustain results.
	Ensures conformance to Plant and Packaging specifications and standards.
	Drives maintenance integrity to maximize equipment availability and reliability while ensuring engineering integrity and close partnership with Maintenance Manager.
	Optimises process capability.
	Leads packaging projects as required.
	Coordinates Packaging logistics, shift patterns and run strategies to maximize GLY, FTE productivity and overall supply reliability.
	Packaging Productivity.
	Proactively control fixed and variable costs.
	Minimise waste.
	Manage, measure and monitor packaging effectiveness through: Packaging efficiency, Trade quality, Raw material usage rate, Waste through beer loss
	IQMS parameters.
	Production costs per Hl to global benchmarks.
	Maintenance cost per Hl to global benchmarks.
	Responsible for the overall reliability of the packaging hall.


Team Leadership:


	Lead the packaging team in a manner that engenders ownership, empowerment and team interaction.
	Lead the development of packaging team goals and ensure these are communicated and understood by team members.
	Conduct regular Packaging team goal review sessions, and conduct regular one-on-one and performance reviews.
	Ensure training need analyses are conducted and training plans developed for team members.
	Ensure appropriate competencies are developed in the team, and ensure cross skilling occurs within the packaging team.


Safety and Housekeeping:


	Ensure that the packaging team apply proper safety and housekeeping procedures, and adhere to all legal requirements when carrying out their tasks
	Ensure implementation of the appropriate SAB and legislative policies (such as OSH act) on safety and housekeeping
	Ensure that safety and housekeeping receive the appropriate focus through regular checks and safety audits
	Where unsafe work practices have been identified, the packaging manager is responsible for correcting this
	Ensures adherence to PPE policy
	General production housekeeping
	Safe maintenance practices audited
	Ensure adherence to the VPO safety pillar in the packaging department with regular coaching and OWD&rsquo;s done
	Ensures adherence to SHE system requirements
	Drive Safety and legal compliance in the Packaging Hall.


Minimum Requirements


	BSc Degree in Engineering or equivalent Engineering degree
	A minimum of 5 years of experience in Packaging Management with deep expertise in asset management
	Experience of managing and running a high-speed packaging line would be highly advantageous
	A minimum of 5 years of experience in managing people
	Demonstrated experience in driving commercial decisions in a packaging hall (financial, operational, people)
	Demonstrated experience in leading VPO in a Brewery environment.


Key Attributes and Competencies:


	A superior performance track record indicating a disciplined work ethic with passion at maintaining quality
	Demonstrated understanding of relevant legislation, specifically health and safety and labour legislation
	Proven experience in managing Industrial Relations within the workforce
	Managing people ability as well as ability to drive performance
	Leadership ability (ability to lead the packaging hall)
	Good interpersonal and communication skills
	Ability to develop and control budgets
	Ability to implement appropriate HR processes to manage, motivate and develop people
	Ability to manage complex projects of a significant amount
	Ability to facilitate problem solving in a team forum
	High level of resilience and ability to operate in a high-pressure environment.


Additional Information:


	
	Band: VI.

	Ensure that the packaging team apply proper safety and housekeeping procedures, and adhere to all legal requirements when carrying out their tasks

	Ensure that safety and housekeeping receive the appropriate focus through regular checks and safety audits
	Where unsafe work practices have been identified, the packaging manager is responsible for correcting this
	Ensures adherence to PPE policy

Minimum Requirements


	BSc Degree in Engineering or equivalent Engineering degree
	A minimum of 5 years of experience in Packaging Management with deep expertise in asset management
	Experience of managing and running a high-speed packaging line would be highly advantageous
	A minimum of 5 years of experience in managing people
	Demonstrated experience in driving commercial decisions in a packaging hall (financial, operational, people)
	Demonstrated experience in leading VPO in a Brewery environment.


Key Attributes and Competencies:


	A superior performance track record indicating a disciplined work ethic with passion at maintaining quality
	Demonstrated understanding of relevant legislation, specifically health and safety and labour legislation
	Proven experience in managing Industrial Relations within the workforce
	Managing people ability as well as ability to drive performance
	Leadership ability (ability to lead the packaging hall)
	Good interpersonal and communication skills
	Ability to develop and control budgets
	Ability to implement appropriate HR processes to manage, motivate and develop people
	Ability to manage complex projects of a significant amount
	Ability to facilitate problem solving in a team forum
	High level of resilience and ability to operate in a high-pressure environment.


Additional Information:


	
	Band: VI.

I.T Support Service Officer Job at Lopterra Services Limited




        
    

        
        Lopterra Services Limited - Our client, a Fast-growing Tech Solutions Provider, is committed to delivering innovative IT services and digital products across diverse industries. Their team is passionate about leveraging technology to solve real-world problems and drive business growth.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: I.T Support Service Officer
Job Location: Magodo, Lagos
Reports To: IT Manager
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Provide first-level technical support for hardware, software, and network-related issues.
	Set up and configure workstations, laptops, mobile devices, and peripheral equipment.
	Troubleshoot and resolve incidents and service requests via phone, email, or in-person.
	Maintain and manage user accounts, permissions, and system access in Active Directory and Office 365.
	Monitor and maintain IT systems and networks, ensuring minimal downtime.
	Support onboarding and offboarding of staff from an IT perspective.
	Provide assistance during technical deployments and events, including video conferencing.
	Document procedures, FAQs, and training materials for end-users.
	Assist in deploying software and updates across devices.
	Maintain accurate records of issues and resolutions using the company’s IT ticketing system.
	Collaborate with other IT team members on infrastructure and security improvements.
	Proficient in Active Directory and asset inventory management
	Restaurant Automation: Setting up and configuration of POS, server, kitchen display system
	Hotel Automation: IPTV setup, configuration and integration
	Develop comprehensive training materials to ensure consistent knowledge across the technical support team.
	Monitored team performance and facilitated the necessary training programs to help maintain a high level of competence among support staff.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
	3–5 years of experience in an IT support role, preferably in a technology-driven environment.
	Proficiency in Windows OS, Microsoft Office 365, and basic networking.
	Experience with Active Directory, remote desktop support, and antivirus management.
	Good understanding of IT security best practices.
	Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and work independently.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Industry certifications such as CompTIA A+, Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP), or CCNA.
	Familiarity with cloud-based tools such as Azure, Google Workspace, or Slack.
	Previous experience supporting users in a tech company or startup environment.


Why Join Our Client?


	Salary: N150,000 - N250,000 Monthly.
	Opportunity to work with global brands and cutting-edge technology.
	Competitive salary, commission structure, and growth prospects.
	Collaborative and innovative work environment.
	Chance to shape the future of AV solutions in West Africa.

Job Position: Business Development Manager
